programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The high-end clients and luxury items continue to roll in, including a celebrity hat designer looking to sell her spectacular diamond-encrusted ruby necklace to raise funds to open a boutique. Paintings by East End gangsters the Kray twins cause a dilemma for the team, and MD James Constantinou tries out a water jet pack. Plus, fake watches lead to a bust-up among staff amid preparations for the grand opening of the flagship store.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: After 12 years of helping clients find their dream homes, Sharon and Steve Garner seek a home for their retirement, selling the family home in the Spanish mountains and moving somewhere more appropriate.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: In Ashurst Wood, West Sussex, the property expert helps to modernise a cluttered 1950s home so retired couple Tim and Gina can take the unusual step of upsizing. In Weybridge, Surrey, he visits a not-so-Swinging Sixties pad inherited by siblings Nigel and Beverley, who need to bring their property up to scratch before potential buyers arrive.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, the President and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday. He aims to discover whether his fast-growing company is running as smoothly and efficiently as possible, but his secret identity is jeopardised when he encounters a colleague he has met on a previous occasion.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help a couple with four children that want to move to the coast to decide between living in Cornwall and Mallorca.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jade and Stuart kick off the competition from Essex with a fun and spontaneous menu, entertaining rivals Mark and Diane, and Chris and Rosella.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete for the cash prize in Yorkshire, serving up a Mexican feast, an Indian-inspired meal and, to round off the week, some no-nonsense `proper grub'.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two young couples who were looking to take their all-important first steps on the property ladder in London. First, Phil meets Cat and Ed, who were searching for a home in the area around Chiswick, before revisiting Ian and Sarah, who were in love with the idea of finding a property in Balham.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: An insight into the Mormon community of Rockland Ranch, Utah, where women choose their husbands through an inspiration from God, and men try to prove themselves worthy and wait to be selected. The documentary provides rare access to the residents' rites, rituals and daily lives. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words and numbers quiz, with Lee Mack and Catherine Tate taking on Sean Lock and Miles Jupp. John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The Super Orgasm
programme.desc: For most women multiple orgasms can seem almost mythical. But some can experience it not once, twice or even 10 times, but 60, 70 or 100 - a super-orgasm. In this documentary, a group of these women volunteer for a series of tests in a scientific investigation to reveal the truth behind the super-orgasm. The aim is to measure and record the phenomenon for the first time, finding out how the brain and the body react before, during and after, and asking if these women are wired differently to other people. And if not, is it something that could be learned by anyone?.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Line of Duty, Mary Berry's Easter Feast, Saturday Night Takeaway, University Challenge, Big Little Lies, The Toilet: An Unspoken History, The Dog with an IQ of 102, and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: The Knowledge: The World's Toughest Taxi Test
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the test that all black cab drivers working in the city of London must take, one of the world's toughest exams - The Knowledge of London. Each candidate must memorise the capital's 25,000 streets, traffic restrictions and ever-changing points of interest, which takes an average of four years of determination to successfully pass.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: It took 30-year-old Louise and her husband Andy six years to conceive. Now they're looking forward to meeting their baby and showing it off to their worried family and health care assistant Olwen. Cameras also follow Sammy, 23, who is about to have her third child. An undiagnosed condition drove a wedge between Sammy and her mum, when her bad behaviour was put down to teenage hormones, until a long-awaited diagnosis of endometriosis when she was 19 enabled them to build bridges.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton help Ginny Lunn search for a holiday home in Dorset or on the Costa Tropical in Spain, with each property expert showing her three options.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin help a couple with four children that want to move to the coast to decide between living in Cornwall and Mallorca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps recently retired Nick and Jane Purser decide between a move to Lancaster or Marseillan in southern France.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: The CEO and chairman of in-store media provider Mood Media, Lorne Abony, goes undercover in one of the fastest growing companies in America. Adopting a disguise in his own business, he finds out how efficiently it is functioning.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits some of the restaurants that he set out to save, including The Mixing Bowl, The Olde Stone Mill, Peter's and Campania. Have their owners pulled themselves out of their nightmares?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to reverse the fortunes of a diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.desc: Junior submits a cartoon in a competition and wins first prize, so Michael takes him to meet TV executives to try to get his talent noticed. Meanwhile, Claire threatens to break up with Tony unless he can bring something fresh into their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Labyrinth
programme.desc: A teenager wishes her baby brother would be taken away, only to have her request granted by a band of goblins and their sinister king. She regrets her decision and sets out to rescue him, but to reach the castle where he is being held, she must find her way through a magical maze full of strange creatures. Jim Henson's fantasy adventure, starring Jennifer Connelly and David Bowie.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary series giving an insight into the world of debt collection. Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy try to collect a debt from a technology company, but with the director nowhere to be seen, the office manager does everything she can to prove the business is no longer trading. Stewart McCracken and Elmor Victor face a heartbreaking house repossession in Merseyside, where two landlords are forced to evict a tenant recovering from a brain tumour which has cost him his job and income.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In east London, High Court Enforcement Agents Paul and Phil are involved in a brothel eviction, while in south Wales, Stewart and Elmore chase a debt owed by a working mum. Another case sees Stewart and Victor hunting down a £3,000 debt owed by a Liverpool takeaway for rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David enjoys getting to know his new father and takes a big step forward with his life. Amy distracts herself from her relationship woes with Leo by helping Jack out at the church.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Tori admits she is contemplating moving to the city with Riley, while Mason asks Olivia to go on a road trip and Alf is delighted that Irene seems to be bonding with her grandchild.(n)

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rivals in the bookshop business fall in love over the internet, unaware they know and dislike each other in the real world. While things remain frosty in person, the pair's anonymous online relationship continues to blossom. Romantic comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, Greg Kinnear, Parker Posey and Dabney Coleman. Edited for language.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.sub-title: Stalked to Death: Countdown to Murder.
programme.desc: On July 25, 2010, nurse Jane Clough was stabbed more than 70 times in the car park of Blackpool Victoria Hospital by her former partner Jonathan Vass, who was out on bail after being charged the previous year with nine counts of raping her. This programme uses dramatic reconstruction to pinpoint the trigger that set the murder in motion, using witness testimony, crime reports, forensic evidence and expert commentary to examine the events.(n)

Australian comedy, starring Toni Collette, Bill Hunter, Rachel Griffiths and Jeanie Drynan.(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: Landmark horror starring Linda Blair as a young girl possessed by a demonic entity, who can only be saved by an exorcism performed by two priests(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: Mel Gibson's impressive directorial debut is a compelling drama in which he stars as a former teacher with a seriously disfigured face and a mysterious past who agrees to coach troubled 12-year-old Nick Stahl for his entrance examination to a military academy(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Harry experiences a bout of teenage angst as he harbours a crush on a fellow-student at Hogwarts. But a strange prophecy reveals itself, and Harry's wizard exams and raging hormones have to remain in the background as he is called into action once again(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Antonio Banderas, Rodrigo Santoro, and Martin Sheen star in this ensemble drama detailing the daring real-life rescue of 33 Chilean miners who were trapped in the San Jose Mine for 69 days in 2010. Patricia Riggen directs from a script by Jose Rivera and Mikko Alanne(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Barry Levinson's comedy drama tells the story of manic forces radio DJ Adrian Cronauer hired to entertain the troops. His irreverent humour and madcap antics endear him to the grunts but bring him into direct conflict with his superiors. The film paints a broad picture of the conflict with Williams justifiably at centre stage in an achingly funny film(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: A Los Angeles journalist befriends a homeless Juilliard-trained musician, while looking for a new article for the paper(n)

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: Spoof of '80s slasher films about a killer who targets a teenager whose mother was brutally murdered the year before(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Tight-knit gang of street racers battle a new nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City
programme.desc: (2005) Adaptation of Frank Miller's graphic novel. A collection of interweaving stories all based in the corrupt, crime infested hell-hole that is Basin City. Heavily influenced by film-noir, the main storylines concern a hulking brute called Marv, who is seeking the murderer of a beautiful woman who was killed while asleep in bed with him, a photographer called Dwight who is callously used and seeks revenge, and a soon-to-be-retiring policeman called Hartigan.Dir: Frank Miller, Robert Rodriguez, Quentin Tarantino(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: The American dream, in the real-life story of a dream team of American... football, of course. Billy Bob Thornton plays Gary Gaines, a coach that began to train a team for a high school tournament and took it to the top. Set in a Texan town, dispirited by the recession, this film - by the actor and rising director, Peter Berg - covers not only the team's progress in the sport, but also the stories of immigrants and social problems surrounding the game and its main figures(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Political drama based on real-life events about a Texas congressman whose intervention in Afghanistan, supplying weapons and other equipment to rebel troops fighting against the Soviet Union, has far-reaching and unforeseen consequences(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Recently widowed Doctor Michael Hfuhruhurr, the world's greatest neurosurgeon, injures Dolores Benedict in a car accident. He operates on her and saves her life using a technique of his own invention: cranial screw-top brain entry. As Benedict recovers, Hfuhruhurr falls in love with her and they are soon married. However, Benedict is only interested in Hfuhruhurr's money and Hfuhruhurr still yearns for his previous wife(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Comedy about a disgruntled chauffeur who kidnaps his boss' beloved dog but finds himself being suspected as the victim in the case when the canny canine gets away. When the dog returns home, the mistress becomes convinced that it is the chauffeur himself who is the victim of a terrible crime(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Directors Bobby and Peter Farrelly making a film about conjoined twins sounds like the ideal recipe for stomach-churning grossness but Stuck on You gets its laughs from others, not the twins. Bo and Walt run a diner in Martha's Vineyard but Walt yearns for Hollywood stardom. Bo agrees to humour him and they hit LA, where Walt lands a part in a TV series starring Cher (the shy Bo has to be hidden by scenery or 'brushed out' from the scene). But Bo harbours a love for LA-based Man, their romance previously conducted on-line while Walt falls for April, an understanding pool babe. Can the disparate pair find love, success and happiness? With cameos from Jack Nicholson and Meryl Streep(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: A dimwitted criminal kidnaps a baby that belongs to a wealthy local businessman in order to make his depressed wife who is unable to have children of her own happy. Soon he finds himself on the run from the police, old criminal acquaintances, and a mysterious motorcycle-riding madman(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
programme.desc: Mike Myers returns as master spy Austin Danger Powers (and, of course, his arch enemy Dr Evil) with a new sidekick in Felicity Shagwell (Heather Graham - The Guru). Dr Evil has invented a time machine and gone back in time to steal Powers' sexual powers, leaving our hero in 1999 without the ability to perform. Not only does he have to rescue his libido but he must also thwart Dr Evil's plan to devastate Earth with a moon-based laser(n)

programme.title: The Intern

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: The Long Morrow. Season Seven of Gilmore Girls begins the proverbial "morning after", as an embarrassed Lorelei (Lauren Graham) scurries home following her one-night stand with ex-lover Christopher (David Sutcliffe, billed throughout the season as a "guest star" rather than a regular). This, however, does not mean that Lorelei is going to patch things up with her erstwhile fiance Luke (Scott Patterson): he has postponed their wedding once too often to suit her, and his impulsive offer to elope falls upon deaf ears. Meanwhile, Rory (Alexis Bledel) seriously considers joining Logan (Matt Czuchry) in London, where he has been "exiled" (with a fat weekly paycheck!) by his powerful publisher father Mitchell. And in the latest in a long line of screw-ups, Kirk (Sean Gunn) and Taylor (Michael Taylor) crash their car into Luke's diner(n)

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. Tim Roth costars as a marine given a "super-soldier serum" that turns him into a similar creature, an able-bodied nemesis of the Hulk. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: San Andreas
programme.desc: In this high-octane thriller, the infamous San Andreas Fault gives way, producing a devastating earthquake across California. A highly skilled helicopter pilot (Dwayne Johnson) races to save his ex-wife (Carla Gugino) in Los Angeles before the complete destruction of the city. After one daring rescue, the pilot flies north toward San Francisco in search of his estranged daughter (Alexandra Daddario), racing against time and the inevitable aftershocks that promise to devastate the coastline(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers(n)

programme.title: The Terminator

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: First Date, Last Date
programme.desc: A couple destined to be together find each other at the worst possible time. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2015 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Police thriller sequel in which maverick cop 'Dirty' Harry Callahan tackles an underground terrorist group and tries to deal with the problem he has with his new partner - a woman. programme.title: Fern Britton's Holy Land Journey
programme.desc: The presenter travels to Jerusalem on a life-changing journey of faith, in search of the real story of Jesus' final days, from his triumphal arrival, to his brutal crucifixion.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle present, continuing the story of the two endangered cheetah cubs, Poppy and Winston, who are set to go out into their open enclosure. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy catches up with a couple who have renovated a former chapel in Goudurst in Kent while Dion checks out a terraced house in Smallthorne in Stoke-on-Trent and Martin hears plans for a basement flat in a Victorian building in Cardiff. All of the properties were sold at auction but will any of the new owners make money from their investments?.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Police crack open a counterfeit champagne case, where the fakers are making a killing, and there is a look at the fake carbon monoxide detectors that could cost lives.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning presents from Elsecar Heritage Centre in North Yorkshire, home to the world's oldest steam engine, where Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt help the two teams.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie is convinced that she can hear things in the roof of The Mill, while Karl meets someone who explains to him what chronic fatigue syndrome is. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which radiographer Brendan from Tunbridge Wells answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple to find a property in Cambridgeshire on a budget of £625,000, and visits a fenland potato farm where she develops a brand new flavour of crisp.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Dave and Harry Rich transform gardens around the country within the owners' budgets, beginning at a terraced home in York.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Walsall, including a broken desk and a formica kitchen table and three chairs.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and Will Axon head to Wells Cathedral in Somerset to uncover some hidden treasures to be sold at auction. Items include a pair of paintings by an amateur artist and a collection of shot and powder flasks. Plus, Paul Martin takes a journey around the historic centre of the ancient city.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon presents the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with swimmer Fran Halsall, St Helens star Jon Wilkin, Olympic bronze medal-winning boxer Joshua Buatsi and Scottish footballer Kim Little joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey tells Martin that Michelle has been invited over for dinner. How will Martin react and can he stay civil for the duration of the meal? Ian and Steven launch their pop-up fish-and-chip shop, and Dot gives Amy and Ricky a lesson about the meaning of Easter. Whitney, Lauren and Abi get ready for their night out - but Lauren's mind is elsewhere.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Restaurant critic Tracey Macleod sets the brief for the third quarter-final, challenging them to cook a savoury dish that showcases rice or a dessert with almonds as the star. After preparing their dish, the candidates must stand before Tracey and presenters John Torode and Gregg Wallace and hear what they think of their offering and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: Valiantly taking the fall for the murky deeds of his fiancee Margot, Paul Pennyfeather finds himself in deep trouble with the law. Will he be able to escape imprisonment, and will his intended wait for him if he doesn't? The concluding part of James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's classic satire set an obscure public school in Wales and which tackles the elite and corrupt institutions of 1920s England, starring Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria, Douglas Hodge, Jason Watkins and Stephen Graham. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Miranda Hart discusses her role as Miss Hannigan in Annie, Keeley Hawes talks about the new series of The Durrells, Peter Capaldi reveals the reasons behind his decision to leave Doctor Who, and Warren Beatty discusses new film Rules Don't Apply. Jennifer Hudson provides the music, performing her latest single Remember Me.(n)

programme.title: Witless
programme.desc: Leanne and Rhona wake up as they are being driven down the motorway in a caravan by a mysterious figure, and news of Ian's death reaches the formidable leader Willy Whelan.(n)

programme.title: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
programme.desc: The chauvinistic host of a top-rated American news programme in 1970s San Diego fights for his status and job security when both are threatened by the arrival of an ambitious female reporter, whose determination to become a newsreader leads to a bitter battle of the sexes. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Fred Willard and Steve Carell.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt serves as host this weekend, as food scientist Mich Turner and chef Tom Kitchin prepare dishes for Grow Your Own Drugs host James Wong.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Absolute Favourites
programme.desc: The veteran cook draws on her wealth of specialist knowledge to share a selection of her recipes, each inspired by a different place. In the first programme, she recalls childhood trips to the seaside, preparing goats cheese and shallot tarts with an innovative walnut pastry, considered ideal for a picnic hamper. She moves on to a family favourite - royal crab and cod fishcakes with tomato salsa, followed by a dinner party classic of sea bass with brown shrimp and caper sauce.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests review the week's headlines and look ahead to forthcoming fixtures, while there are also interviews with Fernando Torres and Didier Drogba.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: The afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre, where two more first-round matches get under way - Ronnie O'Sullivan v Gary Wilson and Kyren Wilson v David Grace. Nine frames are scheduled to take place on each table and the players will be looking to ensure they are at least still in with a chance of progressing to the last 16 when they come back to the famous theatre tomorrow to conclude their fixtures. Plus, updates from the morning's play. Presented by Hazel Irvine.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of complete strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Richard Madeley and his daughter Chloe, JLS star JB and his wife Chloe, Fern Britton and her daughter Grace Jones, and B*Witched twins Keavy and Edele Lynch take part in a families-themed edition of the unorthodox quiz show. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: New series. Peter Capaldi's eccentric, era-hopping Time Lord returns for his final series. However, before he hands over the key to the Tardis to his as-yet-undecided successor, there's the matter of the girl with a star in her eye to deal with. A chance encounter brings Bill Potts into contact with the Doctor, who is conducting a secret mission on Earth. What follows is a terrifying chase across time and space, one that opens Bill's mind to the prospect of a bigger and wider universe than she'd ever imagined. Pearl Mackie makes her debut Doctor Who appearance as new companion Bill, while Matt Lucas also stars as the Doctor's old ally Nardole.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stan Cullen hopes to escape the tyranny of a bullying boss by burning down a building on a secure construction site. However, he is unaware that his wife Tamzin has the same goal in mind, and happens to be inside the building he has set ablaze. Meanwhile, Cal confronts Sam, claiming he has been intimidating Lily into working overtime, and Jez wakes to find himself in the bed of Elle's 17-year-old son Kalen, resulting in a tense stand-off in the ED.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes Brown and her brood are joined in their studio-home by another selection of famous faces, including comedian and presenter Sue Perkins and Diversity's Ashley Banjo, who brings his mum Danielle to meet the formidable Irish matriarch. Former Silent Witness star Emilia Fox, most recently seen trying to solve the mystery of The Missing Crown Jewels in Ant and Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, becomes the latest unsuspecting star to join Dermot and Buster on their Celebrity Tour venture, and Aston Merrygold - whose latest single Show Me was released last month - provides this week's music.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, which include Tottenham Hotspur v Bournemouth at White Hart Lane, and Southampton v Manchester City at St Mary's Stadium. The outcome of these matches could yet prove to be crucial at the end of the season for both Spurs and the Citizens, as they continue to battle for a place in the top four.(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dawn
programme.desc: A fighter pilot is shot down over enemy territory during the Vietnam War and endures a harrowing incarceration in a prisoner of war camp. Determined to escape, he rallies his fellow captives to mount a daring break-out and together they embark on a desperate journey through the jungle. Werner Herzog's drama, starring Christian Bale, Steve Zahn and Jeremy Davies.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team offers advice on what to look out for in the world of Victoriana. Paul Martin visits Wellington College, Caroline Hawley explains her passion for vesta cases and there is a look at what made the Victorians such masters of invention.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev seize equipment from a sports car specialist on behalf of a customer whose car was left dripping oil after a botched repair.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore is joined by Norman Wilkinson and Daniel Heath, who between them revamp a guest bed, a tired armchair and an artist's easel - turning the latter into a vanity unit.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bidford-on-Avon.
programme.desc: The team help transform the home in Bidford-on-Avon of a woman suffering from mastocytosis, a rare genetic disorder, who has been forced to stay in the living room of her family's house under constant care since her diagnosis at the age of 18. Nick Knowles, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and hundreds of Warwickshire volunteer builders redesign the entire house to provide Chloe with independence, creating a self-contained apartment complete with bedroom, wet room and sitting room within her family home.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy
programme.desc: A rebellious fairy steals the magic pixie dust that grants her people the power of flight and runs away, becoming captain of a band of pirates. Tinker Bell and her friends set off to recover the dust, but succumb to a spell that switches their magical powers. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Christina Hendricks and Tom Hiddleston.(n)

programme.title: Easter Parade
programme.desc: A dancer abandoned by his usual partner trains a chorus girl as a replacement. The new pairing is a great success but, although he strives to keep their relationship strictly professional, he begins to fall head over heels in love with her. Musical, with Fred Astaire, Judy Garland, Peter Lawford and Ann Miller. Songs include A Couple of Swells, Stepping Out with My Baby and Shaking the Blues Away.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces day three at the Hong Kong Velodrome, featuring the finals of the men's individual pursuit and points race, and women's omnium and individual sprint.(n)

programme.title: King of Kings
programme.desc: Biblical epic chronicling the life of Christ, from the rumours of a coming Messiah before his birth, through his rise as a spiritual leader to his eventual betrayal, crucifixion and resurrection. Narrated by Orson Welles and starring Jeffrey Hunter, Siobhan McKenna, Robert Ryan, Rip Torn, Hurd Hatfield and Harry Guardino.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Jaguars Born Free: Natural World Special.
programme.desc: When three orphaned jaguar cubs are discovered in a Brazilian forest, a family decides to take the place of their mother and train them to survive in the wild. Over two years the cats must learn to climb trees, swim, and hunt for their food and if they can be successfully released, there will be new hope for this rare species. Narrated by Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry's Easter Feast
programme.desc: Mary explores the foods that bring each different community together on Easter Sunday, as well as sharing her own family favourites, such as mouthwatering roast lamb. She also discovers how the Greek Orthodox community break the fast with Tsoureki bread, spends time in the kitchen with Archbishop of York John Sentamu and discovers Filipino and Italian Easter specialities.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn, and Carol Klein continues her series on her gardening heroes when she visits Waterperry Gardens to find out about the legacy of Beatrix Havergal. Frances Tophill selects her Golden Jubilee plant, Flo Headlam visits a garden centre in Manchester which is run by the local community, and there is a return to Adam Frost's garden, where he gives advice on how to rid borders of bindweed.(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: Premiere. In 1965, amidst an atmosphere of racial unrest, civil rights campaigner Dr Martin Luther King Jr plans a peaceful march across Alabama from Selma to Montgomery. His goal is to persuade President Lyndon B Johnson to change the law, allowing black people to register to vote. Fact-based drama, starring David Oyelowo, Tom Wilkinson and Carmen Ejogo.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: New series. The 50th season of the show gets under way with performances by Kasabian, Goldfrapp, Thundercat, Anderson .Paak & The Free Nationals, Spoon and Courtney Marie Andrews.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Giraffe Manor in Kenya, a unique hotel where giraffe, staff and guests co-exist in a 1930s Scottish-style hunting lodge on the edge of Nairobi National Park. The pair travel to the remote but luxurious outpost of Sasaab Lodge, a six-acre plot set within 82,000 acres of land owned by Samburu tribespeople, who receive a fee for every guest that stays and make up 75 per cent of the staff.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Paula Rego: Secrets and Stories
programme.desc: Making use of new interviews and a vast archive of home video, film-maker Nick Willing compiles an intimate portrait of his mother, the celebrated painter Paula Rego. While Rego has been notoriously private and guarded about her personal life, she opens up to her son, discussing secrets and stories from her live, which has seen her battle fascism, misogyny in art world, and manic depression. Willing's film dictates his mother's story from her native Portugal, where she used her pictures as a weapon against dictatorship, through to settling in London, where she turned her craft toward tackling women's issues such as abortion rights.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Up Periscope
programme.desc: A US Navy frogman is ordered to steal a vital Japanese code book from a Pacific island - but the captain of the submarine entrusted with taking him into enemy waters disapproves of the plan, causing tensions to rise and threatening the mission's success. Second World War adventure, with James Garner, Edmond O'Brien and Alan Hale Jr.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: German scientists in occupied Norway during the Second World War begin work on the manufacture of vital components for an atomic bomb, prompting the Norwegian resistance to team up with British forces on a campaign of sabotage to halt production. Second World War thriller, starring Kirk Douglas, Richard Harris, Anton Diffring, Roy Dotrice and Ulla Jacobson.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: The opening session on day one of the sport's flagship event at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two matches in the first round, featuring Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire on one table and Mark Selby beginning the defence of the title he won for the second time last year on the other against Fergal O'Brien. Presented by Hazel Irvine, with a commentary team including Stephen Hendry, Dennis Taylor and Peter Ebdon.(n)

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.sub-title: Track Cycling World Championships: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Clare Balding is joined by Chris Hoy and Joanna Rowsell Shand to present live coverage of day four at Hong Kong Velodrome. Today's action will feature the men's omnium, which is taking place in its new one-day format, as well as the conclusion of the individual sprint competitions, as well as the women's madison, which is taking place at the World Championships for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Nick Bailey gets to grips with an unpromising patch of grass and gives his tips on how to achieve a luscious lawn, and Carol Klein continues her series on her gardening heroes when she visits Waterperry Gardens to find out about the legacy of Beatrix Havergal. Frances Tophill selects her Golden Jubilee plant, Flo Headlam visits a garden centre in Manchester which is run by the local community, and there is a return to Adam Frost's garden, where he gives advice on how to rid borders of bindweed.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Continued coverage of the first round on day one at the Crucible Theatre, with nine frames scheduled to be played on each table, and Ronnie O'Sullivan and Kyren Wilson in action.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates unusual natural events, with the help of eyewitness accounts, scientists and footage of the occurrences.(n)

programme.title: Easter from King's
programme.desc: A selection of music and Gospel readings for Holy Week and Easter, as part of a week of celebrations held at the Chapel of King's College, Cambridge. The King's College Choir, directed by Stephen Cleobury, sings a variety of popular seasonal choral verses, including God So Loved the World, Ubi Caritas, and Hallelujah from Handel's Messiah. Mezzo-soprano Kiandra Howarth joins the choir for a performance of the Easter Hymn from Mascagni's opera Cavalleria rustanica, and the story of Jesus' death and resurrection is related via readings from the King James Bible, and the poems of Phineas Fletcher, Edmund Spenser, and the former Archbishop of Canterbury Dr Rowan Williams.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.sub-title: Live Snooker: The World Championship: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Coverage of the concluding session on the opening day of the ranking tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where Mark Selby v Fergal O'Brien and Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire reach a conclusion. Selby is given the honour of being involved in the first fixture of the tournament in his role as reigning champion, but will be well aware that several winners have fallen at the first hurdle the following year, as the unique pressure of defending the title in the intimate surroundings of the Crucible have their effect.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.desc: Paul Murton learns how the Highlands became a popular tourist destination when transport links improved in the 20th century. He begins his journey on the shores of Loch Tay in Perthshire, continues through the Rannoch Moor wilderness, climbs the mountain of Buachaille Etive Mor and ends in the spa town of Strathpeffer.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and Sergeant Wilson are trapped in the bank vault with an unexploded bomb - so the Home Guard heroes try to defuse the situation without their savings going up in flames. Jimmy Perry and David Croft's classic wartime comedy, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier and Clive Dunn. First broadcast in 1969.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.(n)

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: A divorced father's rare weekend with his two estranged children descends into horror when alien war machines rise from beneath Earth and begin to systematically destroy every human being in their path - leaving the man with the dangerous task of getting his kids to safety. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi thriller, based on HG Wells' novel, with Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Miranda Otto and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the evening session at the Crucible Theatre, where Mark Selby v Fergal O'Brien and Anthony McGill v Stephen Maguire were scheduled to conclude.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Contest showcasing the very best of young British dance talent. The dancers contesting the contemporary category at The Lowry in Salford are Joshua Attwood, Nafisah Baba, Jacob Lang, Nora Monsecour and John-William Watson. Hosted by Anita Rani, with a judging panel of Sharon Watson, Mark Bruce and Shobana Jeyasingh.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1980 - Big Hits
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the show in the first year of the 1980s, when the rise of a new generation of pop stars signalled a new era for Top of the Pops and for British society. Featuring My Girl by Madness, Brass in Pocket by Pretenders and Geno by Dexys Midnight Runners, as well as appearances by Adam Ant, Spandau Ballet, the Piranhas, Hot Chocolate, OMD, Motorhead and the Beat.(n)

programme.title: Music for Misfits: The Story of Indie
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates an examination of the history of the indie genre, beginning by exploring the origins of the UK's alternative music scene with the emergence of independent record labels and the eclectic sound hubs they spawned in cities across the country. It looks at the impact of Buzzcocks' Spiral Scratch EP from 1977, which was the first independently produced and distributed release of the era and inspired others to set up labels including Factory, Postcard and Rough Trade. Featuring exclusive interviews with performers including New Order's Stephen Morris and Gillian Gilbert, Buzzcocks' frontman Pete Shelley, James Dean Bradfield of Manic Street Preachers, Belle and Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch, Malcolm Ross of Aztec Camera and Orange Juice, and the Jesus and Mary Chain's Jim Reid. With contributions from Influential music industry figures such as Pete Waterman, Factory Records' designer Peter Saville, music entrepreneur Seymour Stein, and music producer and Mute Records founder Daniel Miller.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with music by David Grant, Level 42, the Creatures, Lotus Eaters and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1980.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the music show's evolution, and the dramatic changes that took place in 1980 when a new generation of British pop arrived, leading to the veteran Top of the Pops orchestra being laid off, and the studio audience doubling in size. Featuring Adam Ant, the Human League, OMD, Kevin Rowland, Sally Lindsay, Kelly Marie, Ray Dorset, Johnny Logan, the Vapors, the Piranhas, and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1980 - Big Hits
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the show in the first year of the 1980s, when the rise of a new generation of pop stars signalled a new era for Top of the Pops and for British society. Featuring My Girl by Madness, Brass in Pocket by Pretenders and Geno by Dexys Midnight Runners, as well as appearances by Adam Ant, Spandau Ballet, the Piranhas, Hot Chocolate, OMD, Motorhead and the Beat.(n)

programme.title: Music for Misfits: The Story of Indie
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates an examination of the history of the indie genre, beginning by exploring the origins of the UK's alternative music scene with the emergence of independent record labels and the eclectic sound hubs they spawned in cities across the country. It looks at the impact of Buzzcocks' Spiral Scratch EP from 1977, which was the first independently produced and distributed release of the era and inspired others to set up labels including Factory, Postcard and Rough Trade. Featuring exclusive interviews with performers including New Order's Stephen Morris and Gillian Gilbert, Buzzcocks' frontman Pete Shelley, James Dean Bradfield of Manic Street Preachers, Belle and Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch, Malcolm Ross of Aztec Camera and Orange Juice, and the Jesus and Mary Chain's Jim Reid. With contributions from Influential music industry figures such as Pete Waterman, Factory Records' designer Peter Saville, music entrepreneur Seymour Stein, and music producer and Mute Records founder Daniel Miller.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis continues his journey in Iran, the first time a BBC crew has been allowed into the country for nearly 10 years. He visits Persepolis, the city that was at the heart of the Persian empire, before following an ancient caravan route through the desert. Along the way, he stops at a Zoroastrian temple before arriving at Istanbul, where he discovers the influence the silk trade had on the Roman empire, and finally returns to Venice, where he visits Marco Polo's house. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Tankies: Tank Heroes of World War II
programme.sub-title: The Men and the Machines That Beat Hitler.
programme.desc: Part one of two. BBC diplomatic editor and former army officer Mark Urban examines the exploits of six members of the 5th Royal Tank Regiment during the Second World War, beginning in northern France, where in 1940 rookie driver Gerry Solomon joined veterans including Jake Wardrop and Harry Finlayson. He follows in the soldiers' tracks across the deserts of North Africa, where he looks at the battles of Sidi Rezegh, Alam el Halfa and El Alamein, which changed the course of the conflict. With archive footage, including rarely seen colour film, as well as first-hand testimony from surviving veterans and letters and diaries.(n)

programme.title: Department Q: The Absent One
programme.desc: Premiere. Two detectives who run the Copenhagen police's cold case division are driven to reopen a child murder that occurred at an exclusive boarding school in the 1990s after the victims' father commits suicide. Crime thriller based on the novel by Jussi Adler-Olsen, starring Nikolaj Lie Kaas, Fares Fares and Pilou Asbaek. In French and Danish.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from August 11, with music by David Grant, Level 42, the Creatures, Lotus Eaters and Depeche Mode. Presented by Tommy Vance and Richard Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: Ligue 1 Show
programme.desc: This week's show features interviews with Monaco's Bernardo Silva and Nantes captain Guillaume Gillet. Plus, a profile of Metz star Cheick Diabate and a preview of Angers v PSG.(n)

programme.title: Total Italian Football
programme.desc: A look ahead to this weekend's Serie A fixtures, including Inter Milan v AC Milan, Pescara v Juventus and Napoli v Udinese.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.desc: North Melbourne and Western Bulldogs clash in round four of the Australian Football League. North Melbourne could start a season with four defeats for the first time since 1975.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Rewind
programme.desc: Relive the best bits from the Grand Prix of Argentina, round two of the season.(n)

programme.title: Premier League World
programme.desc: Tony Pulis reflects on his time as a Premier League manager, Djibril Cisse chats about his life after football and Seville midfielder Steven N'Zonzi discusses his time in England.(n)

programme.title: Live Hyundai A-League
programme.desc: Melbourne Victory and Central Coast Mariners clash in round 27 of the Hyundai A-League at AAMI Park. Victory have not lost at home to the Mariners since 2009 - a run of nine games.(n)

programme.title: Premier League Match Pack

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While performing an autopsy for a class of military students, Ducky discovers the cadaver he is using is the body of a murder victim. In trying to identify the corpse, Gibbs and his team are set on the trail of a career criminal specialising in identity fraud. Meanwhile, Ziva has difficulty separating her personal feelings and professional judgment. Starring David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. The ship proves to have been abandoned by its crew, and Ducky discovers the victim died from a highly contagious virus - putting everyone presently on board at risk. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A taxi driver and an admiral working at the Pentagon are found executed by the side of a road, but the agents have trouble ascertaining a motive - until they uncover links to a woman searching for her missing husband, a political refugee from Africa. Meanwhile, McGee makes a discovery about his new girlfriend. Starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby babysits a bright nine-year-old while the other members of the team try to locate the youngster's missing father - a survivalist wanted in connection with a case of robbery and murder. The search takes them deep into the wilderness - where a startling discovery awaits. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A suspect in a drug-smuggling case is seemingly mauled to death by his own dog, which is immediately scheduled to be destroyed - but Abby refuses to hand it over to Navy officials and launches her own investigation. Meanwhile, Gibbs continues to worry about Shepard's health, convinced she and Ducky are hiding something. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Mark Harmon and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine is seemingly killed in a mortar attack on America's heavily fortified administrative HQ in Baghdad, but a subsequent autopsy reveals he was murdered. Intelligence analyst Nikki Jardine volunteers to help Tony investigate the case - but her behaviour in Iraq makes him suspect she had an ulterior motive for requesting the assignment.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Assistant coroner Palmer is called to the building site on a Navy base where a body has been found. While looking into the incident, he spots an armed man fleeing the scene with the victim's passport and is almost killed as he gives chase. It appears the document was stolen to hinder the investigation, but the discovery of a second corpse reveals a case of stolen identity and a compensation racket.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, the entire team is put in danger while hunting for the killer of a former NCIS agent. Jenny Shepard calls in Mike Franks for help, afraid she too is a target - and convinced Gibbs will be next. American crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Vance sticks rigidly to the rules as he investigates the death of a fellow agent, but Gibbs and Franks take matters into their own hands to catch the killers. The case also leads to major changes for the agency. Drama, starring Rocky Carroll, Mark Harmon and Muse Watson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Calvin Lee, an executive naval officer, appears to commit suicide by hanging himself from a public road bridge. When examining CCTV footage of the incident, Sam and Callen discover the dead man tossed away a small object before jumping to his death, and when they learn the late lieutenant commander had been working on a sensitive project involving new cloaking technology for submarines, they immediately take an interest in the item. The investigation draws the team into the furtive world of LA's Chinese community, where they discover Lee might have been harbouring some personal as well as professional secrets. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, Speedle and Calleigh investigate the murder of an unconventional college professor whose body has been found tied to a tree, while Megan and Delko are alerted to an insurance fraud by the discovery of a car with a grisly secret in its boot. American police drama, starring David Caruso, Kim Delaney and Khandi Alexander.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs discovers a link between the murder of a petty officer and the break-up of his team, leading him and new director Leon Vance to uncover a case of blackmail involving an NCIS agent. The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs receives a call from his old friend Senator Patrick Kiley, who claims he is being framed for the murder of a naval commander, and seeks help to clear his name. However, incriminating evidence quickly piles up against him - and a second death complicates matters further. Meanwhile, Ziva lets her hair down to obtain fingerprints from a big oil lobbyist. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs revisits his home town to investigate an assault that left one marine dead and another badly injured, and enlists the help of his estranged father to identify the assailant. Suspicion initially falls on a local man whose daughter was dating the survivor of the attack - but later inquiries uncover a tangled tale of uncertain paternity and forbidden love. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found murdered in his garage, and inquiries lead the agents to his former sergeant. However, Gibbs and the team soon find out that their man is under FBI witness protection as he is about to testify against a mobster, giving him a cast-iron alibi. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.(n)

programme.title: The Streets of San Francisco
programme.desc: Mike and Dan investigate a gang of thieves who use motor cycles to make their getaway. Don Johnson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy bargains galore.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrow's World
programme.desc: Bible-study programme offering interpretations of scripture that provide answers to modern-day problems.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate a government organisation dedicated to child prodigies while researching the death of a marine whose body appeared in the middle of a field disguised as a scarecrow, and realise a 12-year-old could be the killer's next target. Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The marine son of a colonel-turned-preacher is found dead in woodlands after changing his religious persuasion. As the case unfolds, it becomes apparent to the agents that he could have been the victim of a hate crime. Meanwhile, Gibbs' father visits for the holidays. Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy pilot who was wearing an experimental jet pack is murdered in a secluded area, and the strange circumstances of the case lead the team into a confrontation with a no-nonsense attorney who appears to hold a grudge against Gibbs. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is taken aback to discover Tony's father is linked to the team's latest investigation, a politically sensitive case involving an assassination attempt on Prince Sayif, a visiting Saudi dignitary with a taste for the high life. Guest starring Robert Wagner, with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 102. The sharks hear about a life-saving idea, a new learning technique and a burgeoning gourmet-food business(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 304. A towel designed for modesty when changing into and out of a bathing suit; a sweater-quilt combination; a way to keep wine fresh, a cake mix for dogs. Also: an update on a class-notes sharing site for college students. Guest shark: inventor Lori Greiner(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 518. A maker of stylish baby shoes impresses Mark Cuban with her story; a Utah man pitches his pill substitute for food; two sisters try to attract interest in their sun-safe swimwear line for children; and a San Diego entrepreneur claims that his custom playing cards make exercise convenient and fun. Also: an udate on Daisy Cakes, which Barbara invested in during Season 2(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 511. An Austin couple shock the Sharks with the profits they are making from knee-high boot socks; publicists from Santa Monica, Cal., have come up with a stylish clutch that's perfect for carrying smartphones; and a finance expert pitches his idea for customized chocolate bars. Also: a way for kids to personalize their lunch boxes; and an update on a device that prevents objects from falling out of reach between a car's seat and the center console(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 509. A record is broken by one lucky entrepreneur, who accepts an unprecedented amount for a deal, while a producer of Halloween attractions takes some heat for overvaluing her business. Also: a repair wrap from two men in Utah; a product designed to help communicate feelings; and an update on fishing bobbers made from shotgun shells, which Mark invested in during Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 628. A 14-year-old entrepreneur pitches a product for pet owners who want to "visit" their animals while away; a T-shirt that displays hometown pride has celebrity fans and more than $1 million in sales; and Barbara Corcoran invites her most successful partners on a ski getaway in Deer Valley, Utah. Also: software for managing an online reputation(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 627. A Pittsburgh man hopes to green up the landscaping and gardening industries with his sustainable soil replacement for peat moss; two Colorado moms try to make a deal for their sweet-flavored face wipes; business partners present what they believe is a safer way to connect electrical wires; and there's a pitch for a digital text technology that could change the way eBooks are read(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer develops a knack for cooking and challenges Marge to a baking contest. Determined to win at any cost, she resorts to cheating in a bid to avoid humiliation. Meanwhile, Bart holds a `Playdude' party attended by Hollywood veteran James Caan.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa is teased mercilessly by her classmates for having a weight problem. Marge learns school bully Nelson Muntz has never had a paternal role model and invites him to live with the family - much to Bart's dismay.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: She Used to Be My Girl.
programme.desc: Marge is left feeling jealous and dejected by an encounter with old school friend Chloe (guest star Kim Cattrall), who has found fame, fortune and success as a high-flying investigative journalist.(n)

Superhero adventure, starring Billy Zane, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Treat Williams and Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa has to share a room with Bart and finds it difficult to cope with the stress, so Homer comes up with a solution. Meanwhile, Marge becomes addicted to eavesdropping on other people's conversations.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes is put in an awkward position when Freddie turns up with Lexi and asks her to take her. Meanwhile, Neeta and Sally plan to move, but Neeta has some skeletons in her closet, and Marnie steps up her revenge plan.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Krishnan Guru-Murthy and director Karim Shah travel to Myanmar to investigate why its fledgling democracy under Aung San Suu Kyi is already under attack. It is a year since decades of military dictatorship came to an end in the country and Aung San Suu Kyi began leading a new era of civilian government, but the woman hailed around the world is now being criticised for failing to bring real freedoms to many, and the fighting against various rebel groups has intensified.(n)

programme.title: The Wild Weekenders
programme.desc: Adam Buxton, Arthur Williams and Clem Green present a guide to what there is to do in Devon. Comedian Adam checks out the best places to stay, Paralympics presenter and ex-Royal Marine Arthur shows how to get your adrenaline pumping, and food lover Clem finds out how to get the most out of Devon's bountiful produce.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Line of Duty, Mary Berry's Easter Feast, Saturday Night Takeaway, University Challenge, Big Little Lies, The Toilet: An Unspoken History, The Dog with an IQ of 102, and the News.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by Miriam Margolyes and Hayley Squires for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The hosts offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a selection of clips celebrating people who have found fame through viral videos, including the UK's foremost expert in pointless skills, a hands-free beer drinking yoga hack, and a dozy dad's accidental holiday selfie blog disaster.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues her pursuit of the world's wealthiest people, meeting a man who got rich from caravan parks, a motivational speaker who made money helping others, and a man who can gold plate anything to order.(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakers
programme.desc: Four teenage girls are desperate to enjoy a wild spring holiday in Florida, and resort to robbery to fund it. Their brush with the law brings them to the attention of a sleazy gangster, who seduces them further into a life of crime while giving them the hedonistic experiences they crave. Drama, starring James Franco and Selena Gomez.(n)

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Having left behind their idyllic life in Strood, Gabe and Nat are invited to a dinner party in their new town, but as the evening descends into a hell of recriminations and violence, the couple wonder if they have made a massive mistake. Comedy pilot, starring Adeel Akhtar and Eva Birthistle.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton helps Sam and Eryka in Brockley, south-east London. They want to build a contemporary warehouse-style home in a derelict industrial unit.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny hit the road with some stained-glass windows, and decide to add an extra load in the shape of a giant fish sculpture. But they struggle to get it into the van.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Pat asks Robert to keep her cigarette habit a secret - but he later has to come up with an excuse when Amy smells smoke on him, leading to a string of revelations for the family.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the American comedy, Ray has a brush with death while undergoing minor surgery, but pulls through - leaving his family uncertain over whether to tell him what happened.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink bumps into a former friend of Martin's while visiting Maris in hospital. The pair parted on bad terms, so Frasier tries to effect a reconciliation. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge sets out to halt the plans of an unscrupulous businessman intending to defraud Springfield's residents by supplying them with a defective monorail system. Featuring the guest voice of Leonard Nimoy.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma decides to take her Aunt Gladys's advice and start a family - but a day in charge of Bart and Lisa at a beer-themed amusement park soon changes her mind.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart grows frustrated by Homer's lack of interest in him and sets out to search for a new father figure. Lisa tries to break her addiction to an expensive teenage chat-line, but finds it harder than expected.(n)
