programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Millionaire Gordon Cloade's wife is widowed for the second time at the tender age of 23, arousing the suspicions of his impoverished relatives. Fanning the flames of envy and hatred, psychic aunt Kathy Cloade reveals the grieving widow's first husband is in fact still alive, and a second death prompts Poirot to delve deeper into the family's dark secrets. David Suchet stars, with Jenny Agutter, Tim Piggot-Smith and Celia Imrie.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel can't get Gill's remarks about her fling with Will out of her head, so ducks out of attending an awards ceremony with him, fearing their colleagues will believe she's sleeping her way to the top. He finally decides that dating her is too much like hard work and so announces they are no longer an item - a move that leaves Rachel gutted and regretting her behaviour. Janet isn't happy either - it's clear her daughter Elise is about to have her heart broken by Eleanor's son Ade. The duo are soon distracted from their woes by a new case involving the murder of a landlord and his wife who were shot at close range in their pub.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet voices her concerns to Dodson about Gill's drinking, hoping it can be dealt with amicably, so she's unnerved when her observations are taken more seriously than she intended. Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As Gary Bell waits for news about whether he will be offered a reprieve, Geordie and Phil discover a reason to arrest Eddie Jones, a violent husband who beats his wife. However, when Sidney arrives at the station the following morning, he finds Geordie with his knuckles bruised and Eddie dead on a stretcher. Chief Inspector Benson questions his innocence, and although the vicar leaps to his friend's defence, no one can verify his whereabouts when Eddie was killed. At the vicarage, a remark about Mrs Maguire's love life and the accidental loss of some sentimental postcards leave the housekeeper and Leonard feeling raw and misunderstood.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When a body is dredged up from a slurry pit on a remote farm, the investigation forces owner Danny Pryor to admit he has a number of illegal Serbian workers on the payroll. A faded tattoo identifies the victim as Jack Reeves, a young man from the local travelling community, but what is his connection to the immigrants? As the case unfolds, Vera and her team must connect the dots between Jack and a wounded Serbian, and expose the tragic truth at the heart of Pryor Farm. With Mark Bonnar, Mark Womack and Jim Sturgeon.(n)

programme.title: Paranoid
programme.desc: Bobby arrives in Dusseldorf to join the German police investigating the murder of Ruben Locana, found stabbed to death in his swimming pool not long after the murder of his ex in a playground in Cheshire. Coincidence or conspiracy? Meanwhile, the team's attempts to identify the Ghost Detective are complicated by chief inspector Michael, whose interference forces the elusive investigator underground, and chasing a lead has catastrophic consequences for one of the detectives. Conspiracy thriller, starring Robert Glenister, Indira Varma, Dino Fetscher and Neil Stuke.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A shop assistant is hospitalised following an armed robbery, and DI Preston begins to suspect that one of the woman's colleagues played a part in the hold-up. Meanwhile, footage of a drug dealer's car links him to the crime, so officers put pressure on his girlfriend to confess what she knows. Drama, starring Jane Antrobus, Marc Silcock and Zoe Lister.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Dervish and Co are back at the crease but with ball tampering and rule bending rife, a fair game seems out of the question. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Roger worries about who will make the team's teas when Mim is taken ill. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: William departs for boarding school, leaving his distressed sister behind in the care of cold governess Miss Treadwell. Rose buys the girl a puppy to lift her spirits, but Miss Treadwell decides to have the dog put down when Richard and Virginia go overseas.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.desc: James Nesbitt traces connections between landmark TV drama The Fixer, starring Andrew Buchan and Tamzin Outhwaite, and cheap-and-cheerful Midlands motel soap Crossroads, which ran from 1964 to 1988 and made a brief return in 2001 to 2003.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard and Virginia honeymoon in Paris, but on their return are forced to reconsider their hopes of moving into a smaller home. Meanwhile, Eddie and Daisy return to Eaton Place to discover how much life at the house has changed.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James writes a letter to the Times calling on the government to help thousands of unemployed former soldiers and is surprised by the public response to his appeal. The Conservative Party are impressed and offer him a position as candidate at a local by-election.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: When his cousin Cosmo visits and worms his way into Mrs Betts' affections, Silas is enraged and vows to get even. Unfortunately, his plans go awry, leaving him more than a little red-faced. With Sue Johnston, Emma Fielding and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas

programme.desc: Retired couple Hugh and Cecily Branksome settle in the seaside town of their childhood, but their dreams of peace and tranquillity are shattered by the appearance of an old flame of Cecily's. programme.desc: When Greengrass finds an unexploded bomb the Army is called in to deal with it, but one woman refuses to leave her home. Police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard.(n)

programme.desc: Nick investigates a spate of sinister burglaries, while Greengrass and Blaketon become trapped underground while searching for buried treasure. Nick Berry stars.(n)

programme.title: Maigret

Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon as the pipe-smoking sleuth.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth goes on an Egyptian cruise on board an old steamer, but when an American heiress is murdered, his little grey cells go into overdrive. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: The family faces the unwanted arrival of a domineering aunt, while Larry's girlfriend also pays a visit - giving the unwelcome relative an opportunity to voice her disapproval of the whole family. Sven makes an offer that helps Louisa cope with adversity and Margo falls in love - but Gerry is more concerned with his newly acquired owlets.(n)

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in the second in a run of adaptations of Georges Simenon's books. Maigret is distracted from a string of attacks on three wealthy farms by a series of anonymous phone calls from a man who claims a gang is trying to kill him. He and his trusty associates LaPointe and Janvier go in search of the caller, which leads them to the discovery of a body that has been dumped out of a car. Maigret is convinced the corpse is the man who phoned him - but his face has been mutilated, making it impossible to confirm his identity.(n)

programme.sub-title: A Little Bit of Heart - Part One.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate an Iron Age hill fort in Cardiff that dominates a city housing estate, and explore whether the site could be the long-lost ancient capital of south Wales. With five acres of ground and half a mile of ramparts and ditches to examine, time is not on their side, but, helped by the local community, finds such as the remains of jewellery and drinking vessels help paint a vivid picture of domestic life around 800BC.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Long-time friends Jackie Venn and Jane Howes adore Italy and have pooled together all their savings seeking a renovation project in the region of Abruzzo. They want a substantial property offering views, olive trees and a layout that suits their different needs, so turn to property expert Sara Damergi to help them achieve their objectives.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Bedfordshire couple Dean and Karen Dhinsa find a rural retreat in south Tenerife. The pair dream of spending their retirement in a sunny climate, and are looking for a home within easy reach of the island's beaches, complete with a cave to transform into a cinema, all on a budget of £180,000.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five people from Swindon take turns trying to throw the perfect dinner party. International DJ Mark Eteson hosts the first night and hopes his Ibiza-style menu featuring Bora Bora Beach brownies, paella and fishcakes will be a hit, before challenging his guests to a rave-off which he will judge himself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amateur dramatics enthusiast Michaela Kearns hosts the second party in Swindon, but admits she is not much of a cook. She hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamour-filled evening featuring melted chocolate with dipping treats, but anticipates she might not be able to persuade her fellow diners to take part in her planned show tune performance - complete with a full band.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Financial advisor Scott Hillier hosts Swindon's third party, hoping to impress his guests with a Wild West-themed evening. Tensions run high as Gill Bright awkwardly apologises to last night's host Michaela Kearns and Scott Hillier hopes to smooth things over by performing a rap.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Direct sales manager Sally Rachael hosts the fourth dinner party in Swindon, featuring a `girls' night in' theme with mysteriously titled dishes and a quirky dress code that leaves her guests clueless and unhappy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alternative therapist Gill Bright hosts the final dinner party in Swindon and has plans for an `upstairs downstairs' Edwardian-themed evening with sophisticated food followed by some circle dancing to Bob Marley.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Shannon Slater-Dent and Trevor Tredgett's Bove Town House in Glastonbury, but a poor night night's sleep bothers Kathryn and Trevor from Treberthan B&B.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Treberthan B&B in Par, Cornwall, where owner Kathryn Langley and her best friend Trevor Burnell set out to give their guests a taste of Cornish hospitality.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at SugarBeat Eating House in Swainsthorpe, run by Stevie King and head chef David Lovett, but the establishment's cleanliness quickly comes under fire.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Fritton Arms in Norfolk, run by Ben Davenport and partner Sian Dewaal. David and Stevie are upset about their feedback so they conduct a forensic-style room inspection - complete with rubber gloves - and a paddleboat race on a nearby lake brings out everyone's competitive nature. Ben impresses the guests by revealing the hotel's aristocratic connections - but soon comes under fire for allowing pets to stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners reunite to find out what they have been paid, with Shannon and Trevor from Bove Town House wanting to discuss Kathryn's comments about her poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Eve Booth hosts the first dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, expressing concern that her starter of haggis and black pudding may not be to everyone's taste. Although her main course gets a lukewarm reception, the biggest threat to the evening seems to be fellow contestant Ken Brown's taste in jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer and gypsy wedding supplier Paula Thompson hosts the second party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to bring a touch of class to the proceedings with her `black and bling' themed event. The evening's menu includes fresh lobster and hairy prawns, accompanied by a spot of belly dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old languages student Donal Anand-Shaw hosts the third dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and decides to make the event black tie. He also arranges for a string quartet to play, and serves up a locally-sourced scallop starter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt collector Eleri Watson hosts the fourth dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside. However, her efforts to organise an all-Welsh evening do not go according to plan when soil is found in the leek soup and lamb is served burned, dampening the guests' enthusiasm.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a `wear a wig' themed evening. After annoying his fellow contestants over the past week, he hopes to make amends with his unique entertainment, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After 20 years of travelling, a couple decide to build a contemporary, sustainable family home in the remote Campsie Fells in Stirlingshire, Scotland. Theo and Elaine Leijser have given themselves six months to finish the project on a very tight budget and complications soon arise when they source materials from all over the world, including a Swedish timber frame and cedar wood from Canada. Kevin McCloud observes their progress.(n)

programme.title: Spin
programme.desc: New series. Spin doctor Simon Kapita works hard on behalf of his client, President Alain Marjorie, when the leader of this far-right party is assassinated. The attack provokes a violent outcry from supporters and throws the political parties into turmoil, triggering a ruthless race for power. Meanwhile, in the President's private life, his relationship with his wife Elisabeth comes under increasing scrutiny from the tabloids. Kapita's former colleague and protege Ludovic Desmeuze backs a radical candidate from the right and the two men are pitted against each other in what becomes the most lethal battle of their lives. For Kapita, this latest campaign is also the most dangerous. Political thriller, starring Bruno Wolkowitch. In French.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three-year-old Louie is airlifted to St George's after being run over by a car while playing outside, with doctors expressing concern about his neck, which seems to be stuck in one position. Elsewhere, 14-year-old Josh is treated after injuring his ankle when riding a BMX with his father on the front. Meanwhile, 41-year-old Sam arrives in resus with a cut to her head and possible spinal and internal injuries after losing control of her car and crashing into a tree.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Tom is rushed to St George's after crashing his bike head first into a parked car while racing a friend. Doctors order a CT scan to assess his injuries and must decide whether he will need emergency surgery to his face. Plus, 26-year-old Andy comes to A&E after injuring his knee during a game of Frisbee, and 51-year-old Jason arrives after suffering from blurred vision for two days.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Bridgeport, Connecticut, to visit Cafe Tavolini, which is being neglected by husband and wife managers teetering on the edge of divorce. The estranged couple's two children are struggling to save the business from their parents' disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three-year-old Louie is airlifted to St George's after being run over by a car while playing outside, with doctors expressing concern about his neck, which seems to be stuck in one position. Elsewhere, 14-year-old Josh is treated after injuring his ankle when riding a BMX with his father on the front. Meanwhile, 41-year-old Sam arrives in resus with a cut to her head and possible spinal and internal injuries after losing control of her car and crashing into a tree.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Host Jimmy Carr is joined by team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for highlights from the last series of the comedy panel show. Guests including Jack Dee, Claudia Winkleman, Danny Dyer, Joe Wilkinson and Alex Jones answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton visits the Discovery Coast of Essex, beginning at the quayside in Maldon on a Thames barge and his first port of call is a small wooden shack that's been converted into a two-bedroomed seaside home. He also visits a development with swathes of glass and recessed balconies. On Mersea Island, he views a converted bungalow, an art deco refurbishment on the seafront, and a detached Victorian villa in Leigh-on-Sea.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp searches for a family home around Hove on the south coast of England for Duncan, Anna and their three children, as they return from seven years living in Switzerland. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer helps couple Mick and Bernie look for a property to downsize to when they retire in the South Downs.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A woman searches for a dream home in West Sussex on a budget of £450,000, allowing her to also pay the deposit on her daughter's first home in London. But it swiftly becomes clear she may have to make a few compromises to move to this expensive part of the country.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity manager Andrew Batsford hosts the first of a week of parties from Hastings, aiming to inspire his fellow contestants with a menu of dishes prepared using foraged ingredients, including sea broccoli and stinging nettles. However, if the food fails to win them over, he hopes a dynamic Wham!-themed evening of festivities will do the trick.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Hastings, East Sussex, and retired solicitor Adrian Carter is hoping to impress his guests with a Moroccan-themed evening. However, disaster strikes when he neglects his tagine, and his rendition of a Rod Stewart classic does not go down well either.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sally-Anne Keller hosts a German-themed dinner party on the third night in Hastings, East Sussex, and requires her guests to dress, sing and dance accordingly. Charity manager Andrew Batsford explains how the principles of anarchism and punk can be applied to football, while retired solicitor Adrian Carter dresses as the 19th-century statesman Otto von Bismarck and raises eyebrows with his jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Kate Eadon hosts the fourth dinner party in Hastings, East Sussex, with a menu styled on a gourmet pub meal. Adrian Carter gets himself in hot water, Sally-Anne Keller reveals a surprise celebrity crush, and the host recounts her own encounter with a famous funnyman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The confident Stelios Michael hosts the final night in Hastings, East Sussex, hoping to impress his guests with a Greek-inspired evening. The diners get involved when they receive a masterclass in the country's traditional dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Richard III in Middleham, North Yorkshire, a pub run by Ken Ward and his wife Sharon, who become suspicious when one couple check out before breakfast. The village is known for its horse racing links, but one of the competitors, Matt Wilson, has a fear of horses, and another couple are concerned at staying above a noisy pub.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Court House Unique Boutique B&B in Shelsley Walsh, Worcestershire, where hosts Keith and Lisa Shearin hope to impress. On arrival, Ken and Sharon are blown away by their honeymoon suite and the seemingly low price. Suspicions over price fixing drive Matt and Paul to the internet to verify the room rate, where they discover an anomaly, and despite Keith's best efforts at breakfast, Jo and Louis dismiss it as being too fancy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Castley Camp in Otley, West Yorkshire, for the third day of the contest, owned by single mum Jo Stevenson and her son Louis. Some of the guests are horrified by stains on their bedding and dust in their room, while an afternoon boot camp fitness session reveals Keith's competitive side. At feedback, Jo is left fuming over the comments about cleanliness and breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final two days see the contestants staying the night at the Lion & Swan in Congleton, Cheshire, run by owner Paul Whyle and manager Matt Wilson. A dirty bathroom and a waterbed cause upset, while some guests are still fuming about previous negative feedback. However, the worst is left for breakfast, when Sharon reveals she has discovered their rooms online at a higher price than they were told, upsetting Keith and Lisa and leaving the hosts determined to clear their names.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. First up are Ken and Sharon from the Richard III, who want to learn more about what's been causing Jo and Louis to lose sleep. Next, Keith and Lisa from the Court House Unique Boutique B&B want to challenge Matt about the allegations of price fixing and vehemently fight their corner. Needless to say, there is tension in the air and axes to grind, before the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trucker Tony Houston holds the first dinner party in Clacton-on-Sea, Essex, hoping his menu of scallops on black pudding with pea puree, and seabass with prawn mash will impress his fellow diners. However, if his food fails to live up to his expectations, he anticipates the whole ambience and presentation of the evening will secure him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Anthony Street hosts the second day in Essex, and has his work cut out trying to impress the diners after displaying some unusual table manners the previous night. However, he hopes his passion for quirky entertainment will be enough to win them over.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Claire Kelly hosts the third dinner party in Essex. Her devil-may-care approach does nothing to dampen her confidence, and she is convinced hers will be the winning night. Even if her chaotic cooking style and haphazard evening fail to win over the guests, the mother-of-two has some special entertainment lined up to gain a few extra points.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur and foraging fan Richard Harris hosts the fourth night of the competition in the Clacton-on-Sea area of Essex. Not everybody is impressed when they discover he has had help, and Claire Kelly accuses him of being a food snob. However, he hopes a performance by the local church choir will help improve the atmosphere.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher Kerrie Brinkley-Whittington hosts the final dinner party in Essex, and uses a few props to help her night go with a swing. However, she is soon under fire from entrepreneur Richard, who is not amused to be asked to contribute more to group conversations, and when trucker Tony makes an emergency run to the garden, it looks as if the rhubarb dessert could be just as controversial. At the end of the evening, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare's Tomb
programme.desc: Documentary charting a two-year-long archeological investigation of William Shakespeare's grave at Holy Trinity Church in Stratford-upon-Avon. The grave itself bears a curse condemning anyone who disturbs the Bard's final resting place, reading `Good friend, for Jesus' sake forbear/To dig the dust enclosed here/Blessed be the man that spares the stones/And cursed be he that moves my bones'. For the first time since Shakespeare's death 400 years ago, the church has authorised archaeologists to conduct a study on the site, giving Kevin Colls of Staffordshire University, leading geophysicist Erica Utsi, and Cambridge historian Dr Helen Castor a chance to utilise state-of-the-art radar technology to build up a picture of what lies beneath the surface without disturbing the hallowed site. As the team reveals, the results of their examination contained a few unexpected surprises.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition revisits the changing social attitudes reflected on the small screen in the 1960s, including humorous shows which took liberties in the name of satire, disability being mocked and bulletproof vests being put to the test on live TV. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Peter Purves, Valerie Singleton and Melvyn Bragg.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, revisiting the time of revolution on the small screen in the 1980s. This edition focuses on the concept of fear, dealing with the threats of heroin, glue-sniffing and Aids, Keith Chegwin assessing the impact of video nasties and a young Jeremy Paxman discussing how to survive a nuclear war. With contributions by Joan Bakewell, Nigel Farage, Jennie Bond and Chris Tarrant.(n)

programme.title: The World's Greatest Spy Movies
programme.desc: A countdown of the 10 most thrilling espionage films of all time, chosen by real spies and spy-masters from MI6, the CIA and the KGB. The programme untangles fact from fiction, from Le Carre-style gritty realism to the outlandish espionage fantasies of Jason Bourne, and British superhero James Bond, revealing which film comes closest to the truth, and which has won the number one spot.(n)

programme.title: Search for Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Chronicling efforts to locate the vessel that, according to the Bible, was built by Noah to survive a massive flood. Included: origins of the flood claims; a look at satellite imagery and underwater geological surveys used by "arkologists" in their search. Also: theologians, geologists and archaeologists discuss different ark theories(n)

programme.title: The Hunt for the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Exploring the history and religious significance of the Israelites' Ark of the Covenant, a chest built at Moses' behest (and first mentioned in the Bible in Exodus 25:16). It is said to contain testimony of God's pact with the Jews and the tablets holding the Ten Commandments. Solomon placed the Ark in the Temple at Jerusalem (1 Kings 8:6-9), but it has been missing since the Babylonians destroyed the temple in 586 B.C. This hour includes speculation as to what might have happened to it(n)

programme.title: The First Jesus?
programme.desc: In this Nat Geo special we explore the mysteries of a recently discovered stone tablet that may speak of a messiah before Christ, who rose from the dead after three days(n)

programme.title: Riddles of the Bible
programme.desc: Archaeologists, biblical scholars and historians examine and seek answers to mysterious passages in the holy book(n)

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: Something nefarious is afloat in the depths of Bikini Bottom: King Neptune's crown has been stolen, and the prime suspect is Mr. Krabs, SpongeBob's boss at Mr. Krabs' Krabby Patties. Despite the overwhelming evidence against Mr. Krabs -- not to mention having been turned down for a long-awaited promotion at the restaurant -- SpongeBob (voice of Tom Kenny) refuses to believe that his boss is responsible and teams up with his best friend, Patrick (voice of Bill Fagerbakke), on a mission to Shell City, where he hopes he can exonerate Mr. Krabs and return the crown to its rightful owner. Of course, this is no easy task; once outside the safety of Bikini Bottom, SpongeBob is faced with the overwhelming dangers of the sea, not the least of which being a cyclops that many believe to be responsible for the deaths of countless other unfortunate sea-creatures who ventured outside county lines. Among those who lent their vocal chords to the film include Scarlett Johansson, Jeffrey Tambor, and Alec Baldwin(n)

A couple fly in from Atlanta for the wedding of their dreams and a butler prepares a suite for one of the hotel's most valued guests, bringing furniture, hat boxes and 20 suits out of storage for just one night. programme.desc: A special episode about the life of Mary, Queen of Scots, following her as she stumbles from young girl in Scotland to queen in France, back to queen in Scotland, and finally to Elizabeth I's arch enemy. Plus, the programme meets silver-nosed Danish scientist Tycho Brahe, and Mr H gives his unique take on the epic Battle of Lepanto in another edition of History's Craziest Fools.(n)

programme.title: Junior MasterChef
programme.desc: The cooks compete for a place in the semi-final, and must create their ultimate sweet and savoury pancakes from a range of mystery ingredients. They then produce their favourite dishes in the hope of impressing judges John Torode and Donal Skehan, which include a lamb biryani and a strawberry and chocolate tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: Focusing on European football's elite club competition, featuring highlights, news and previews of forthcoming matches, as well as a look through the archives at classic battles featuring some of the game's greatest players.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Merseyside-based inspector Anthony Joynes travels to south-east Africa to work with his counterparts in the Malawi capital Lilongwe, rescuing two puppies from an illegal roadside vendor and a stray dog riddled with disease. Back in the UK, Graeme Petty responds to a call about two dogs that have been left outside for a long time and he must make a tough decision when the owner returns home. Plus, the programme catches up with Susie, a feral dog rescued by inspector Vicki McDonald. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Richie Rich
programme.desc: The world's wealthiest youngster has everything he could possibly want except friends. When his parents go missing, he must try to keep their fortune out of the clutches of a scheming executive, with the help of some less well-off children. Family comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, John Larroquette, Jonathan Hyde, Edward Herrmann, Christine Ebersole and Mike McShane.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel starts taking regular cigarette breaks to ingratiate herself with new boss Kim and colleague Nancy, even though she does not smoke, while Joey competes with Ross's son for a role in a TV commercial. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Gleason (Boogie Nights).(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Sea Otters - A Million Dollar Baby.
programme.desc: Following the life of a sea otter pup growing up on the coast of California, in an unusual location among the yachts of a marina. Its mother must teach her baby how to avoid the boats and find food in the busy harbour, but an attack by a tough male otter signals disaster for the family. Narrated by Bonnie Greer.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Epic Journeys
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following a thousand elephants as they come together in a crucial gathering in Northern Kenya, while facing threats from both predators and poachers. Liz Bonnin and a team of scientists and filmmakers use cutting-edge tracking technology to follow individual elephants as they cope with daily challenges and make the most of this unique, short-lived gathering. They also capture surprising new behaviour and witness how the elephant society responds to poaching, including the way in which young elephants cope with the loss of their parents.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: The series turns to animals that fly, including footage of half a million mother bats, an agile sparrowhawk raiding for food, and large beetles taking to the sky as part of their mating ritual. The programme also reveals how peregrine falcons are able to reach speeds of 200mph, and why an albatross's nose helps it to fly. Narrated by Suranne Jones.(n)

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: A 40-year-old man who refuses to grow up drags four reluctant childhood friends back to their home town to recreate a pub crawl they attempted in their teens. As they work their way round the 12 local bars, they stumble on a threat to the entire human race. Sci-fi comedy, starring Simon Pegg, Nick Frost and Martin Freeman.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Children in Need Special: Edinburgh.
programme.desc: For the 2012 BBC charity appeal, Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a centre in Edinburgh for children with additional needs. The Yard is an indoor and outdoor centre that helps 1,500 youngsters and their families each week, providing a space where families can gain much-needed respite while their children make friends, develop their confidence and learn life skills. However the building is in urgent need of a complete overhaul, so the SOS builders are joined by local tradespeople giving their time for nothing to help this worthy cause.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Million Pound Build for Children in Need 2013.
programme.desc: As part of the 2013 appeal, Nick Knowles and the team head to Peterborough to help Children in Need-funded organisation Little Miracles, which supports youngsters with disabilities and life-limiting illnesses and their families. However, whereas Mark, Chris, Julian and Billy normally renovate an existing property, for the first time they are knocking down a building and reconstructing it from the ground up - making it worth almost £1million. With just nine days to complete the job, they'll need help - and lots of it. Luckily, tradespeople turn out in force - from both the local area and across the country - giving their time for free.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In an extended edition, Nick Knowles and the team visit Lake Como in Italy to help DIY bodgers John and Kay Short, who are confined to one floor of their new home and almost sharing a bedroom with their grown-up daughter. In Tolentino, near the Adriatic coast, Brigid Calderhead comes to the rescue of Ben Craven and his heavily pregnant wife Lisa. They have managed to make most of their home habitable, but with only six weeks to go before the baby's arrival, the nursery is still not ready.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Children in Need 2009 Special.
programme.desc: Special edition of the property makeover show, marking Children in Need 2009. Nick Knowles and the team meet a father and his four children who have spent four years living in a caravan in their garden after a succession of disasters forced them out of their one-bedroom house. The experts have two weeks to renovate the property and build an extension suitable for the whole family. There is also a look at how the charity's sponsored projects are helping a nationwide housing problem.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS Special - Tour de Force: Tour de Force - France Special.
programme.desc: The team visits the South of France to help expats who have left Britain in search of a new life, but whose new homes are in need of urgent treatment. Nick Knowles and his motley crew renovate the kitchen and bathroom of a couple's 15th-century farmhouse in Mayenne, while Lowri Turner and her gang travel to Draguignan to sort out a child's bedroom.(n)

programme.desc: Police try to crack down on irresponsible lorry drivers by taking to the nation's motorways in their own HGV. programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin heads to Dorset to help a couple, who have lived in London all their lives, find a property in the Dorset countryside with a budget of £650,000. He also tries his hand at the ancient art of stone balancing.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts cast their eyes over some land in Leicester, a town house in Chester-le-Street, Co Durham, and a mid-terrace in Maidstone, Kent.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a flat in Wimbledon, a two-bedroom bungalow in Derby and a property in Durham, and then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.desc: Denise Nurse helps a GP and his wife search for a home in Stirling on a budget of £400,000, and visits the Falkirk Wheel, the world's only rotating boat lift.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Hereford.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Hereford couple Colin and Clare Gibbons, whose life together fell apart in 2012 when their eldest son Christopher was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, one of the most severe forms of the condition. Despite having a lovely house, it needs adapting to Christopher's needs for both now and in the future, so the DIY SOS team - bolstered by dozens of local tradespeople - descend on the property to add a two-storey extension, with designer Julia Kendell on hand to ensure they stick to her vision while adding a few finishing touches of her own.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team travel to Toll Bar, the South Yorkshire village devastated by the summer floods of 2007, on a mission to transform two of its water-damaged buildings. They tackle the home of Doreen and Velda Leith, who have looked after more than 50 foster children over a 15-year period, before renovating a local club to try to provide much-needed space and facilities for the community.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton meets a couple of teachers who enjoy travelling around the world, but would like a home in the Cotswolds, so he searches for a country property on a budget of £450,000.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple on a budget of £425,000 move to the north Norfolk coast, and heads to Blakeney Point to see grey seals in their natural habitat.(n)

programme.title: Super Rich: The Billion Dollar Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them.(n)

programme.title: The World's Biggest Penis
programme.desc: Documentary lifting the veil on the taboo subject of whether size matters and what it is really like to be well endowed. `Gifted' males, including one who claims to have the world's biggest penis, reveal there are in fact disadvantages to what nature has bestowed, as they describe the reality of living out many men's dream.(n)

programme.title: My Tattoo Addiction
programme.desc: The documentary hears from people whose love of body art has had a profound effect on the way they conduct their lives. Mark's many photo-realistic tattoos challenge accepted notions of taste, and Deke talks about his attempts to conceal one particular image from his girlfriend's parents. In Magaluf, reveller Liam tries to persuade other holiday-makers to brand themselves with his `burger nipple' design, while Joanne's tattoo of an ex-wife's name is a painful reminder of her previous life as a man.(n)

programme.sub-title: Ka Pohaku Kihi Pa'a (The Solid Cornerstone).
programme.desc: When the task force's long-time informant is accused of murder, McGarrett brings in an old friend to defend him.(n)

programme.desc: Gordon's orang-utans swap houses with Sally's chimps, but the task of switching habitats proves to be a mammoth operation involving the veterinary team and the primate care staff.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: Everything changes for Lulu, Rodders, Ash, Brian and Sally, who now have other chimps living nearby. Meanwhile, baby marmoset Leo is finally well enough to meet his new housemates.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist visits the jungles of Borneo to meet creatures that like to glide through life - the harlequin tree frog and the little-known colugo - often referred to, incorrectly, as a flying lemur. He also has a CGI-assisted encounter with the first true vertebrate flyer, the pterosaur, receives a flying lesson from a small flock of swans at Loch Lomond in Scotland and encounters the planet's largest species of bat.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria rents a cabin in the mountains in which she hopes she and her family will be able to enjoy a picture-perfect white Christmas. However, when the clan arrives, unhelpful weather and a random eccentric guest conspire to ruin the festive cheer. Meanwhile, Mitch and Cam resolve to make up for their bad carolling experience last year, and Jay has a huge announcement that catches Claire off-guard. Comedy, starring Sofia Vergara.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The American comedy returns after a mid-series break. Jay struggles with the age gap between the parents of Joe's latest play date, while Cam he tries to act as matchmaker between Lily and her crush, only to discover that he's completely misunderstood the direction of her affections. Elsewhere, Claire and Phil attempt to split the bill with cheque-dodging friends on a double date, and Haley, Alex and Luke run into Goodfellas star Ray Liotta while searching for a last-minute birthday surprise for Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fed up with having the ducklings around the house, Claire and the kids hatch a secret plan to help them fly the nest. Meanwhile, Jay helps out Mitchell when he throws a slumber party for Lily's Vietnamese dance troupe and Gloria and Manny are forced to stage a hot pepper heist when a huge sauce order comes in.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Luke hold Claire back as she tries to declutter, Cameron panics when Jay decides to take up a new hobby and Gloria tries her hand at golf.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

It proves a stark warning for Callen and the team, who kickstart an operation to find whoever leaked the information before more agents' identities are compromised. Concern grows for Kensi in Afghanistan as she turns herself over to the insurgents in an attempt to find the White Ghost.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

They get a lead when forensic evidence reveals the victim had ingested a date-rape drug, but the case is almost derailed when the girls' father decides to take matters into his own hands. Guest starring Masi Oka (Heroes).(n)

programme.desc: Kono's former surfing mentor is shot dead during a competition, and suspicion falls on her ex-lover Ben Bass. Unable to believe he is guilty, she sets out to clear him and find the real killer with the help of McGarrett, Chin Ho and Danny. Guest starring Kevin Sorbo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover DEA agent is seconded to the team as they look into an explosion at a local fish market. Was it an act of terrorism or a drug deal gone wrong? In Afghanistan, Kensi investigates a helicopter crash connected to the elusive White Ghost, only to be put off her stride by an unexpected blast from the past.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The comedian hops across the Channel and jumps on a bicycle to sample the sights and sounds of France, joined by his best friend Noel Lynch, a brickie and cycling enthusiast. The pair start off in Calais with some essential pampering, fully aware that no cyclist worth his or her salt would hit the road without a facial or a leg wax. Then it's bon voyage as they tackle a small portion of the 150-mile race between Paris and Roubaix lovingly known as the Hell of the North. The cobbles may look pretty - but they aren't bike-friendly.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The comedian and his friend Noel Lynch stop off to sample a few glasses of bubbly at some of the region's premier champagne houses. Later, a spot of nudity is called for when Micky picks the brains of a British couple who like to frequent a naturist camp, while Noel takes on one of cycling's greatest challenges.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The comedian and his friend Noel continue their journey through France by heading south. Stopping off in Camargue, they are thrown into the thick of an annual gypsy festival and sample the wares of a cosmic wine-maker. The duo move on to St Remy and the Saint Paul de Mausole, a psychiatric hospital that uses art and music to treat troubled individuals - and it turns out one of the centre's most famous patients was Vincent van Gogh. In Monaco, they are joined on their bikes by former F1 star David Coulthard, before Micky makes a splash in a transvestite bar in Cannes.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Detour de France
programme.desc: The end is in sight for comedian Micky Flanagan and best mate Noel Lynch, but before they say `au revoir' to France, they have a few more trips to make. They begin in Marseille, the second largest city in the country, where they learn about the ancient martial art of savate and taste the world's most expensive soup. Then it's on to Lourdes, before a quick trip to Bordeaux to sample a particularly revered bottle of wine and visit a museum dedicated to berets. Their tour comes to an end in Paris, city `de l'amour', where they seal their bromance on the Love Lock bridge.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town

programme.title: Fish Town

programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Death Becomes Her
programme.desc: Two romantic rivals are both granted the secret of eternal youth by a mysterious mystic. However, as they battle to get their claws into a plastic surgeon, they discover their now-immortal bodies are capable of taking whatever damage they can dish out. Black comedy fantasy, starring Goldie Hawn, Meryl Streep, Bruce Willis and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, quit her bad habits and take a step up the career ladder. Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mother's infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy based on Helen Fielding's novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: How to be Single
programme.desc: A woman who has rarely been without a boyfriend moves to New York following a break-up with her boyfriend. She makes a fun-loving new friend, who introduces her to the city's nightlife and teaches her to enjoy the advantages of being single. Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: A woman struggling to cope with a rebellious daughter and a marriage that has strayed into a rocky patch discovers a shocking family secret - her parents marriage is not legal. She decides to try and resolve the situation by getting the family to rally round and organise the most elaborate wedding imaginable. Romantic comedy sequel, starring Nia Vardalos and John Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occur in New York city, a quartet of investigators and their dim assistant investigate. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth.(n)

Comedy, starring Dakota Johnson, Rebel Wilson, Alison Brie and Leslie Mann.(n)

programme.title: White Men Can't Jump
programme.desc: A basketball hustler working Los Angeles' courts uses his goofy appearance to lull his opponents into a false sense of security. He forms an uneasy alliance with a fellow conman and rival to make a financial killing, but his debts soon catch up with both of them. Ron Shelton's comedy, starring Woody Harrelson, Wesley Snipes and Rosie Perez.(n)

programme.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut
programme.desc: The crusading grown-ups of the Colorado town lead America into war against Canada in a bid to eradicate bad language from TV. The four young heroes set out to bring peace to the world, but have to battle a fearsome alliance between Satan and Saddam Hussein. Animated musical comedy, with the voices of Trey Parker and Matt Stone, as well as George Clooney, Eric Idle and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Grease 2
programme.desc: A shy English boy joins the senior class at Rydell High and immediately falls for the leader of the Pink Ladies. But she is only interested in tough guys, forcing him to adopt a dual identity as a mysterious biker. Musical sequel, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Maxwell Caulfield, Lorna Luft, Eve Arden and Sid Caesar, with Didi Conn reprising her role as Frenchy from the original film.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Excitable beat cop Ben longs to work alongside his fiancee's brother, hard-boiled detective James, who does not think he has what it takes. James decides to show Ben that he is not cut out for the job by recruiting him to help bring a drug dealer to justice. Comedy sequel, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Olivia Munn.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby

When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: The Little Mermaid
programme.desc: Underwater princess Ariel becomes bored with her aquatic existence and spends her time spying on humans, much to the annoyance of her father. Longing to live on land, she strikes a deal with a banished sea witch in order to become human and meet a prince - but there is a price to be paid. Disney's animated adventure, with the voices of Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes and Rene Auberjonois.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin.(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: My Favorite Martian
programme.desc: A TV journalist meets a stranded alien who is trying to repair his crashed spacecraft. After first planning to exploit the chance of a big story, he instead offers his help after befriending the visitor - but a fellow reporter plans to expose the truth. Sci-fi comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Christopher Lloyd, Jeff Daniels, Elizabeth Hurley and Daryl Hannah.(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Bambi II
programme.desc: The young fawn is reunited with his father, a wise stag, in the aftermath of his mother's death. The older animal reluctantly takes on his parental responsibilities, teaching his son the ways of the forest and helping him find the courage to face the challenges ahead. Disney animated prequel, with the voices of Patrick Stewart and Alexander Gould.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Stitch! The Movie
programme.desc: Animation following the further adventures of the little alien, as a host of his fellow experimental creatures arrive on Earth. However, their chaotic efforts to make themselves at home are threatened by the evil Captain Gantu, who is hot on their heels and determined to capture them. With the voices of Chris Sanders, Daveigh Chase, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Peter Pan
programme.desc: Three children are visited in the night by a magical flying boy and a fairy named Tinker Bell. The strange youngster takes them away to his home, the magical island of Neverland, where his band of runaway youngsters are engaged in an ongoing battle with a crew of pirates. Disney animated adventure based on JM Barrie's novel, with the voices of Bobby Driscoll and Hans Conried.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride
programme.desc: The one-time leader of the gunslinging band, now a marshal, turns down an old ally's call for help in dealing with a gang of Mexican bandits. However, when the desperados kill his friend and his own wife, the lawman puts together a new team and sets out to take revenge. Western sequel, with Lee Van Cleef, Stefanie Powers, Mariette Hartley and Michael Callan.(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo.(n)

programme.title: Hyena Road
programme.desc: Adept Canadian sharpshooter Ryan Sanders and his unit are forced to take refuge with an village elder while on the run from Taliban fanatics in Afghanistan. Resigned to their fate, the soldiers anxiously wait for the old man to betray them to his countrymen, but instead he saves their lives, then disappears without a trace. When Sanders reports this unusual turn of events on his return to Kandahar, seasoned intelligence officer Pete Mitchell is convinced the sniper has happened upon the legendary Afghan freedom fighter known as the Ghost, and enlists Sanders' aid in tracking the man down once again to assist in the war effort. Military drama, starring Rossif Sutherland and director Paul Gross.(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer, and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin.(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent is assigned to infiltrate a gang of daredevil extreme sports athletes, and prove that they are responsible for a string of audacious bank robberies. As he pushes himself to the limit to prove his worth to the group, he forms an intense relationship with their enigmatic leader. Action thriller remake, starring Edgar Ramirez, Luke Bracey and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The eccentric detective and his confidant Dr Watson investigate the apparent resurrection of a criminal mastermind with links to the occult, who is carrying out a series of seemingly magical murders. The case is complicated by the reappearance of Holmes' duplicitous old flame Irene Adler. Action thriller, starring Robert Downey Jr, Jude Law, Rachel McAdams, Mark Strong and Eddie Marsan.(n)

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The masked avenger stalks the streets of Gotham City, waging a nightly war against the criminal element. However, he may have met his match when the city's crime syndicate is taken over by the crazed Joker, who plans to poison the populace with toxic chemicals. Tim Burton's comic-book adventure, starring Michael Keaton, Jack Nicholson and Kim Basinger.(n)

programme.title: xXx2: The Next Level
programme.desc: The American secretary of defence forms a covert military organisation with the intention of assassinating the president. A government spymaster is ready to foil the plot but, since his top agent is dead, he has to recruit an imprisoned soldier to help him. Action sequel, starring Ice Cube, Samuel L Jackson and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A fast-talking former mercenary develops terminal cancer, and agrees to be the subject in a shady experiment in the hope of a cure. The procedure leaves him horribly disfigured, but also possessing superhuman abilities which he immediately puts to use in a quest for revenge on the man responsible for his hideous appearance. Superhero comedy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Morena Baccarin.(n)

programme.title: Point Break
